listing.listing_description:
This stunning villa on Croatia's Split Riviera is situated outside the picturesque town of Primosten on the Adriatic coast, just steps from a small private beach. Built on a lofty slope, the three-story home commands breathtaking, panoramic views of the sea and islands from its multiple terraces and luminous interiors. Its gorgeous stone walls and gleaming white surfaces evoke the rustic charm of Dalmatia and timeless spirit of the ancient Mediterranean, while exquisite furnishings and high-end appliances embody contemporary Croatian elegance. With cooking and dining amenities on all three levels, the seven-bedroom villa forms an ideal haven for multiple couples, family reunions, and destination wedding guests.

The expansive outdoor living areas welcome enchanting days and evenings in the Adriatic breeze, with room for festive gatherings or quiet, intimate moments. The lower terrace features a gem-toned swimming pool and lounge chairs for basking in the sunlight, while its sitting area and dining table inspire gourmet delights amid sublime vistas. The mid-level terrace boasts a lounge and a smaller dining table, and there is a spacious balcony above.

A trio of arched doorways open into the main living area, infusing the open-concept space with the light and breath of the sea. The fully equipped kitchen serves a comfy TV salon and beautiful dining table. Kitchenettes and smaller living/dining areas accompany the upper-level bedrooms. The villa's two wine fridges will store the spoils of your local vineyard visits.

The bedrooms are furnished and decorated with elegant simplicity, accentuating the natural light and exalting views. There are four suites with king beds and three with queen beds. Six of the bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms, and the top-floor bedroom enjoys a private balcony.

The villa offers a lovely home base as you explore the Split Riviera and Dalmatian islands. You're within easy reach of several pebble beaches, suitable for swimming, snorkeling, diving and various watersports. Primosten is about five to ten minutes away on foot, and features excellent dining, shopping, nightlife, and medieval architectural gems. Drive east along the coast to historic Trogir and the heart of Split, or north to the precious splendors of Krka National Park.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Taras is an extraordinary villa for twenty-four guests in the Southern Italian region of Puglia (Apulia), near Ostuni. Consisting of a main house, guesthouse, and trullo (a traditional cone-shaped dwelling native to the Itrian Peninsula), the home is nestled on an ample estate amid olive groves and fruit trees with beautiful views of the countryside. Its expansive outdoor areas include three swimming pools and multiple dining areas, while the exquisite interiors blend rustic charm with high-end contemporary comforts.

Step into the sparkling water for a refreshing dip in the open air, and bask in the Mediterranean sunlight on elegant loungers. Enjoy breakfast at the table under the portico, and gather for alfresco feasts at the long table table under the pergola. Families will enjoy the wide spaces for exploration and play, and gourmet guests will revel in the bountiful vineyards and orchards. The roof terrace with plunge pool enjoys panoramic views of the Puglian hills.

The villa's interiors are at once cool and cozy, with luminous white walls that accentuate the natural light and bucolic beauty of your surroundings. Each unit—the main house, guesthouse, and trullo—features a private cooking and dining area. The largest are in the main house, where the kitchen is fully equipped with high-grade appliances and the dining area features lovely French doors to the gardens.

There are seven bedrooms in the main house—four on the ground floor and three on the upper floor—all with ensuite bathrooms. The master bedroom (on the ground floor) enjoys a king bed and a private entrance, while the other bedrooms have queen beds. In the guesthouse, there are three queen rooms with ensuite bathrooms and a king room with access to a private (non-ensuite) bathroom. The superb trullo includes a queen bedroom and ensuite bathroom.

From this private estate, you're ideally situated for exploring the riches of Puglia and Itria. The region is famed for its fifty million olive trees and stunning beaches and port cities on the Adriatic and Ionian coasts. The hilltop, white-washed city of Ostuni, with its extraordinary mix of Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque architecture, is only four kilometers away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Look out over one of the last hidden-gem beaches on the Algarve at Villa Mar a Vista. Perched on a cliff above the golden stretch of beach fronting the quaint village of Salema, this luxury vacation rental affords gorgeous panoramas of the azure sea and and whitewashed town. Invite up to six friends or family members to share this contemporary retreat—or reserve this oceanfront residence for a sun-splashed honeymoon in Portugal.

The villa opens to a terracotta terrace with pergola-covered sitting and dining areas overlooking the Mediterranean. Follow the steps down to the lower-level terrace to stretch out in one of the sun loungers or take a swim in the infinity pool. In the evenings, try out locally caught octopus on the charcoal barbecue or, on cooler nights, cozy up inside by the wood-burning fireplace.

Contemporary architecture and African art give the interiors of Villa Mar a Vista a fresh, modern personality. A wall of sliding glass doors links the open-concept living and dining areas to the terrace, flooding the space with light. The fully equipped kitchen is tucked behind the dining area and features an espresso machine, ice maker and more.

Each of the villa’s three bedrooms has a king bed, balcony and view of the sea. The master suite has a private en-suite bathroom, and the other two share a hall bathroom. Larger groups on holiday together can make use of a fourth room with a sofa bed and shared hall bathroom, as well as its own balcony and sea views.

From the villa, it’s a short walk down into Salema, a quiet fishing village that’s been discovered by visitors but hasn’t lost much of its traditional charm. Watch the fishermen unload their catch each morning, swim in the clear waters, hunt for the preserved dinosaur footprints on the beach or sip a drink at a waterfront restaurant. It’s a short drive to the golf course and tennis courts at the Santo Antonio resort, as well as the shopping and dining options in Lagos.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Ermal is an enchanting villa in the Apulia (Puglia) region of Southern Italy, situated between Ostuni and Brindisi, within minutes of Lido Bianco Beach and the town of Carovigno. The modern home offers a graceful balance of high-end comforts and traditional Puglian charm, emphasizing the pleasures of open-air living. Ample outdoor spaces include a beautiful pool terrace with inset spa, a shaded loggia, and a generous patio with alfresco dining for twelve. Air conditioning, an alarm system, Wi-Fi, and excellent media features create a comfortable environment for all guests, while the luminous kitchen will inspire the gourmet traveler. Five superb bedroom suites with ensuite bathrooms—including two separate guest houses—welcome families and groups of friends up to ten in size.

The Adriatic Sea is visible on the horizon, bathing the estate in dreamy breezes. Enjoy sunny days on the terrace, soaking in the hot tub and plunging into the refreshing pool. Bask in the light on lounge chairs and savor cool drinks in the shaded loggia. Fire up the barbecue in the afternoon, and gather for delicious meals on the spacious patio. Linger outdoors in the evening, sipping glasses of Puglian wine under the starry sky.

The kitchen is the home's heart, featuring chef-grade appliances, a breakfast bar for five, and large glass doors opening to the alfresco table. Lovely lighting and accents of wood and bamboo create a welcoming, natural atmosphere. The living room offers a comfortable retreat, with thick-cushioned sofas and a cool, soothing palette of grays and blues.

There are three king bedroom suites in the main house, each with an ensuite bathroom. The guesthouses offer extra seclusion, with queen beds, lounge areas, ensuite bathrooms, and private entrances from the gardens. All of the bedrooms have air-conditioning and TVs. These arrangements are ideal for destination wedding guests or corporate retreats.

Apulia is a relatively untrodden paradise of Southern Italy, with extraordinary beaches and vineyards and a distinctive culture manifesting in its fabulous cuisine and traditional architecture. The famous "white city" of Ostuni is twenty kilometers away, set amidst the enchanting Itria Valley—famous for its cone-shaped trulli houses. The beaches of Lido Bianco and Torre Guaceto (a pristine nature reserve with a 16th-century tower) are also within easy reach.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Close to Trecastagni, a village on the slopes of Mount Etna, and just 20 km from Catania, is where you’ll find this refined home, one of our most elegant villas in Sicily. This area of Italy is known for its beaches, mountains, volcano, historic attractions, and of course—its delectable food. You’ll find plenty to keep you amused here – in the warmer months enjoy the large in-ground swimming pool. Afterwards, lay out in the sun on a lounge chair nearby with a cool drink in hand and take in views of the property’s gardens. Kids and the young at heart will love a challenging round of ping pong or foosball. A twice-weekly tidying service and linen change is included, ensuring a comfortable stay. A welcome basket awaits you upon entering the villa for the first time. It’s a good introduction to the home’s inviting atmosphere, which includes high-end furnishings, rich fabrics and refined accents. This modern split-level home feels spacious and uncluttered and with a living room on each level, there’s plenty of room for everyone. The fully equipped masonry kitchen is outfitted with all the appliances you need, from a microwave to an electric oven and a dishwasher. Up to seven guests can be comfortably accommodated in this 3-bedroom villa in Sicily. Two rooms have double beds, while a third has two twins, and each includes an ensuite bathroom with a tub or shower. An additional single bed is located off of the hall leading to the master bedroom. Explore the surrounding area’s rich, historical attractions. At just over 2 km away, Viagrande’s shops, restaurants, and tennis court are conveniently close. Beach lovers can choose from rocky or sandy beaches, both just a short drive away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Just a mile from Piccadilly Circus, this finely furnished London apartment offers a unique experience amidst inventive decor in the UK capital’s heart. With rooftop views of the London Eye, descend into a well lit and artfully-furnished home, with a space-age kitchen, crafted dining table and refined sitting space. Plan shopping and dining trips to London’s cosmopolitan core, just outside. 

The stylized steel railings and toned ceilings of the building’s entrance hallways provide a strong stylistic welcome to guests, as they enter this thoughtfully-outfitted home. A spacious and long central room incorporates the gleaming kitchen, dining area, and comfortable seating area. This open-plan approach includes a diverse but unified set of decor choices, with plush, colorful cushions, rich hardwoods, and golden, naked bulbs enlivening the interior. The lengthy rooftop terrace is a great spot to take in the city’s vista, while the old-school sinks and tubs of the spotless bathrooms hark back to England’s industrial heritage.

From this location, guests can experience the best that London has to offer. Step out onto the street and walk the short distance to the fun-time shopping and theater zone around Piccadilly Circus, one of London’s most famous districts. Take in the royal splendor of Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, or experience an eye-opening Thames River cruise or heady spin on the London Eye ferris wheel. A profusion of international restaurants and “real ale” drinking houses are located just a short walk from this most convenient of apartments.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Located on a beautifully scenic countryside property in Central Algarve, this spacious Portuguese vacation rental is perfect for a family reunion, high-end corporate retreat, or destination wedding. With six ensuite bedrooms, lavish interiors, and a back terrace decorated with lush lawns and vibrant greenery, you’ll have no trouble setting the mood for an unforgettable event or vacation. Nearby, you’ll be able to visit the sandy shores of Faro Beach, explore natural and historical wonders, experience authentic Portuguese cuisine at the many restaurants in Estoi and its neighboring towns.

Vila Vale Mouro’s elegant white-washed exterior provides the perfect contrast to the vibrant blues and greens of Algarve. Decorated with arched doorways, lavish water features, a swimming pool, and intricate stonework, Vale Mouro’s scenic terrace is sure to melt all your stresses away. Inside, the open concept lounge contains the formal dining area and living room. The focal point of the room is an imposing stone fireplace with a widescreen television above. Just beyond, a wide, arched doorway to the fully equipped kitchen makes sure the social flow and atmosphere of Vila Vale Mouro aren’t interrupted, even when preparing meals. And upstairs, each en-suite bedroom possesses its own unique character, thanks to their exciting accent walls.

During your stay, you’re sure to appreciate the villa’s entertaining features, like cable television, Wi-Fi, an integrated sound system, and a game room with a ping pong table and video game console. At dinner, Vale Mouro has formal dining inside for twelve and space for fourteen at the alfresco set on the terrace. For something more casual, fire up the wood oven and try your luck at making pizza.

When it’s time to get out and explore Algarve, Estoi is the perfect place to start. Spend an afternoon wandering the winding cobblestone streets and village square, which is just a short walk from Palacio do Visconde de Estoi, an eighteenth-century palace considered to be one of the finest buildings in Algarve.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Forget about maps, driving, and planning. Instead, wander ancient streets with someone special, stumbling upon bustling restaurant patios and inspiring architecture. When you’ve had your fill, return home to your historic apartment in the heart of Florence for a night-cap on the terrace and some people-watching over Piazza Santa Croce. Do it all again tomorrow, but this time, turn left instead of right for a whole new experience.

When you’re not out exploring Florence, the elegant interiors of Lion Nero will provide an iconic Italian ambiance. Decked out in Carrara marble, parquet flooring, and warm leather furniture, Nero shows off modern sophistication and classic style. Cutouts in the walls connect the kitchen, living, and dining room, making it easy for guests to talk the night away. And, an eclectic collection of art, although thoughtful and intriguing, only hints at the beauty beyond Nero’s walls.

Let the local markets and Lion Nero’s fully equipped kitchen inspire you to try your hand at preparing some traditional Italian cuisine. Dine with up to 8 guests inside or if it’s a meal for one, take your plate out to the terrace. On nights in, curl up on the sofa to catch up on some reading or kick back and watch the soccer match on television.

Home to many architectural and artistic triumphs of the Renessaince, Florence is the perfect muse for aspiring photographers. Nero’s central location comes in handy, as early mornings and late nights are the most hassle-free times to visit popular sites. Duomo, Galleria dell’Accademia, and Uffizi Gallery are all musts if you’ve never been. And, for a quick snapshot of what to expect from Florence, walk 4 minutes to Casa Buonarroti, a museum that holds some of Michelangelo’s earliest sculptures.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Chalet Les Anges is a spectacular luxury home at Zermatt, one of the prime jewels of the Swiss Alps. Situated in a peaceful setting about ten minutes on foot from the heart of the village and ski slopes, the chalet feels like a private resort unto itself, with superb outdoor living areas, high-end wellness amenities, and outstanding staff and services including a private chef. The ideal position offers privileged privacy and breathtaking views of the Matterhorn, while placing you within easy reach of world-class dining and sporting destinations. With ample and flexible accommodations for up to fourteen guests (including four king suites), this child-friendly vacation rental is ideal for large or multiple families.

The chalet was built in a classic alpine style with natural timber and beautiful stone masonry. Multiple balconies and a spacious deck offer ample room for savoring the open-air pleasures of Switzerland, including alfresco meals in the warmer months and soothing whirlpool soaks as you gaze at the Matterhorn's iconic profile.

Inside, the vaulted, open-plan great room features expansive, mountain-view windows, lovely sitting areas surrounding a three-sided modern hearth, a gorgeous grand piano, and a lovely dining area opening to the deck. The kitchen is fully equipped with high-grade gourmet appliances, while superb media features include a home theater and iPod docking station. Your vacation rental comes with chef services six days per week, a villa manager, and a fine selection of beverages including champagne, spirits, and wine.

Four bedrooms suites boast king beds, while the three guestrooms feature pairs of twin beds that can be arranged as split-kings. All of the rooms enjoy ensuite bathrooms with tubs and showers, as well as air conditioning. The master suite includes its own fireplace and gazes out on spectacular mountain views.

There is hardly a finer location at Zermatt for groups seeking serene privacy along with convenient access to the slopes and town. You’ll find restaurants, bars, wellness amenities, grocery stores, and the local train station within a ten-minute walk of the chalet, as well as some of the world's finest skiing, hiking, and mountaineering.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Impressive large half-moon windows lined up across the industrial-chic steampunk living room add visual interest to the sophisticated deep gray, black, and white palette throughout this apartment. It’s a modern space for business entertaining with the compact gloss white L-kitchen or to meet up with old friends, or to see and be seen in one of the artsiest areas of London. Practically everything in Soho is within walking distance, taxi or tube from here.

Berwick Street I is in a repurposed industrial building. A lift takes you to the door. A glass- walled entry with black accents creates the impression of open space. But, it’s a retro 50’s take on a business divider creating a structured flow from room to room. The layout is perfect for late afternoon cocktail parties or intimate after-theatre suppers. Dropping into your favorite fabric shops or searching for that rare, long-lost vinyl before heading back to change for cocktails and dinner with friends works perfectly here.

Soho is the heart of the theatre district. All the little antique shops, delightful cafes, and restaurants, its jumble of clothing boutiques, fabric shops, and most notably rare record shops combine to shape and define this unique area.

Ala-carte services are available for amenities like a private chef, grocery shopping, pre-stocking, or arranging any particular activities, or outings. Our concierge service is just a phone call away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Leila is a quintessential Tuscan patrician villa positioned high atop a hill on a large estate in the Chianti area. Although the villa is an ideal retreat for privacy, rest and relaxation, the city of Florence with all of its wonderful boutiques, restaurants, arts and culture is easily reached in just twenty five minutes. A stay at Leila will put you on top of the world – figuratively and literally. Perched at over 1,000 feet above sea level, with panoramic views of the surrounding forest, olive groves and vineyards, get ready for the perfect holiday in Tuscany!

The outside features at Leila include a verdant park, a private heated swimming pool, a tennis court and a soccer field. All of these options add especial value for guests who love outdoor living and staying active on vacations. You will absolutely adore lounging or dining on the terrace in this wonderful atmosphere that is seamlessly integrated with the beauty of the outside world around you. Don’t forget to mount the tower and take in the 360 degree views!

The villa’s interior understated elegance evokes old world charm while creating a warm and inviting atmosphere all at once. The interior features a home entertainment system and plush, largely monochromatic furnishings. The fully equipped kitchen is bright and spacious with a center island – a dream for the culinary genius in your group.

Spoil yourself in any of the eight posh and supremely comfortable bedrooms. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning, televisions and DVD players. You will find a variety of sleeping arrangements from king beds to queens and twins, so there is sure to be something for everyone.

Leila is a perfect accommodation for family gatherings or a group of friends who may appreciate opportunities for privacy while vacationing with their entourage. This villa is a highly recommended property and early booking is advisable. While Tuscan cuisine favors simple items like bread, cheese, fresh produce and olive oil, the art from this area of the world, from the Renaissance to today, has achieved legendary status. Get the vacation you deserve this year in Italy!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Coki is a stunning villa in the Italian region of Apulia is built in the classic Trulli style native to the Itria Valley, with conical limestone rooftops and beautiful masonry. Situated near the town of Martina Franca, the villa is less than four kilometers from Alberobello and within easy reach of Apulia town, Ostuni, and both the Adriatic and Ionian coasts. This unique vacation rental offers a quintessential, rustic experience of Puglia's countryside, enhanced by high-end amenities for cooking, dining, and relaxation. Accommodations for ten people make it an ideal choice for family reunions and private gatherings of friends amid the vineyards and architectural splendors Southern Italy.

With its stylishly bucolic ambiance, the villa's expansive estate invites you to long days and evenings in the open air. Step into the sparkling pool for a refreshing dip, and relax on elegant lounge chairs under the Mediterranean sun. Relish a barbeque lunch alfresco in the canopy's shade, and sip a local wine at sunset in the outdoor salon.

The interiors are designed to keep you cool on summer days and cozy on winter nights. A comfortable den includes sofas and a lovely table for coffee or breakfast. The kitchen's vaulted ceilings and exposed wood cross-beams cast an enchanting country ambiance, while high-end, chef-grade appliances will inspire the chefs among you.

Coki features three rooms with queen beds, two of which are split-queens that can be arranged as pairs of single beds. There is also additional bedding on the mezzanine level (a queen bed and ensuite bathrooms) and a separate room with a sofa bed, ensuite bathroom, and private entrance. One of the split-queen rooms features a stand-alone tub and dual vanity, and one enjoys a private entrance.

From this private estate, you're wonderfully positioned for exploring the charms of Puglia and Itria. Discover the Baroque architecture and culinary delicacies of nearby Martina Franca; venture to the luminous, white-washed city of Ostuni, with its extraordinary mix of Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque architecture; and marvel at the myriad of trulli buildings in Alberobello, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Look out over the Adriatic Sea and Croatia's neighboring islands from the oceanfront balcony of this sleek villa on Korcula. Lay back in a sun lounger and work on that tan while the kids play beneath the pool's waterfall. On your way into town for dinner, stop off at Prigradica Beach, just 5 minutes away. Then, drive 10 km to the town of Korcula for traditional fish stew and local wine.

Stone-clad walls cover all but the ocean-facing side of Villa Palma de Korkyra, leaving you with sweeping views. Each bedroom enjoys an ocean-view as well. When you're in the kitchen, the open concept layout will ensure you never miss a beat in the conversation. After dinner, slide open the patio doors and feel the breeze throughout the stylish interior.

Rather dine outside? Fire up the charcoal grill and keep it casual with a backyard barbecue. While you're working on the perfect sear, the kids can bounce on the trampoline. Then, gather around the alfresco set. Now that you've earned a break, rejuvenate in the sauna or jacuzzi, burn off extra energy in the exercise room, or take a nap by the fireplace.

Late afternoon is the perfect time of day to take a windsurfing lesson. Schools all around the island offer lessons and equipment rental, and it's all suitable for first-timers. If you'd rather stay dry, take a cycling tour of scenic coastlines, Lumbarda Vineyard, and Old Town. For more ambitious riders, the 25km "Path to Racisce" is an incredibly scenic journey on the way to a historic fishing village.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

Bedroom 2: Queen size bed, Ensuite bathroom with stand-alone rain shower, Access to shared balcony, Sea view
Bedroom 3: King size bed, Ensuite bathroom with stand-alone rain shower, Television, Safe, Access to shared balcony, Sea view

listing.listing_description:
Be charmed by the Tuscany of yore—even as you revel in modern comforts—at Il Fienile Di Montesoli. Though the name of this vacation rental translates roughly to “the barn at Montesoli,” it’s been lovingly renovated into a luxury getaway in the countryside near Siena. Reserve its four bedrooms for an Italian escape with friends and family, or for a honeymoon that’s truly away from it all.

Il Fienile sits on manicured grounds with beautiful views of the surrounding hills. Watch the sun move across the landscape from a lounger on the terrace by the pool, relax in the outdoor sauna, play a game on the bocce court or see what’s growing in the vegetable garden. After sunset, heat up the barbecue for dinner at the al-fresco table or have a glass of local wine inside by the TV and Wi-Fi.

Traditionally charming on the outside, the villa is classically elegant on the inside. High ceilings, wood floors and arched doorways distinguish the two refined sitting areas, which feature rich tones of red and cream. The color scheme continues in the open-plan dining room and fully equipped eat-in kitchen.

The villa has three bedrooms with California king beds and one bedroom with a king bed. All four have private en-suite bathrooms, and can accommodate groups of up to eight on holiday together. Details like graceful accent chairs and architectural drawings as artwork make the bedrooms feel like stylish retreats.

Use your stay at Il Fienile Di Montesoli to explore the countryside, stopping in at wineries and cafes or strolling through small towns. It’s an easy drive to the Borgo la Bagnaia golf course if you’d like to play a round, and just a bit farther to Siena, where you could easily spend several days delving into the city’s UNESCO-designated historic center.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Set on a hilltop outside the spa town of San Casciano dei Bagni, Villa Serena offers a quiet retreat in the heart of Tuscany’s Val d’Orcia region. The two-story, six-bedroom stucco villa is surrounded by over 50 acres of private woodland, guaranteeing privacy and peace. Stroll the formal gardens, relax by the pool or spend the day at the Roman spas in town, just minutes away.

Start the day with a coffee at the seating area on the covered patio overlooking the swimming pool, taking in the views and smelling the rose, jasmine and lavender in the garden. The patio also includes a table and chairs for al fresco dining. In spite of its rural location, the villa is well-connected, with satellite TV/ SMART TV, telephone and Wi-Fi access.

Inside, traditional style furnishings in modern, neutral tones have comfortable, casual appeal. In the living room, green gray sofas and armchairs offer plenty of seating and are set off by red and white throw pillows and a Persian-style rug. The rustic chic vibe continues in the dining room and eat in kitchen, which is fully equipped and opens to the garden to let the breeze waft in.

Each of Villa Serena's six bedrooms is air-conditioned (in the main house). The master suite has a king bed, en-suite bathroom, walk-in closet and access to a patio. Two more bedrooms, one with a king bed and one with a queen, each have an en-suite bathroom, walk-in closet and access to a terrace. There’s one bedroom with two twin beds and an en-suite bathroom. The other two bedrooms have a queen bed and two twin beds, respectively, and a shared bathroom. Additional accommodations are available in a room with two twin beds, an en-suite bathroom and separate entrance (No Air Conditioning).

The shopping, restaurants and thermal spas of San Casciano dei Bagni are just a 5-minute drive from Villa Serena. It’s worth exploring the Val d’Orcia area, too, to sample local specialties like wine, game and cheese and take in the landscape. If you’d like to take a day trip, Cetona is a 30-minute drive away, Pienza, Montepulciano & Montalcino only 1 hour drive away, Siena is a 90-minute drive away, Florence is a 105-minute drive away and Rome is about 2 hours by car.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

ul.li: 5 minute drive to San Casciano dei Bagni

feature.p: While other parts of Tuscany have developed industries that have done much for the economy but little for the landscape, the "Crete Senesi" area and the neighboring "Val d'Orcia" have largely remained true to their early agricultural vocation. Today this means local products of outstanding quality, made with traditional methods and skills that are handed down from generation to generation. The best-known of these are Montalcino's distinguished Brunello red wine and the Vino Nobile of Montepulciano, both of which are the perfect complement to dishes based on the wild game of the area: pheasant, quail, hare, and wild boar. Likewise, the Pecorino cheeses made with ewe's milk from the Pienza pastures are now in great demand. One of the best food stores in the Pienza area is La Cornucopia (2 Piazza Martiri della Liberta) where you can find sweets, honey and cheeses.

While visiting the famous wine producing town of Montalcino and the artistic jewel of Pienza, you will be fascinated by their charm and history. Montalcino has a wealth of superb paintings and sculptures that make its beautifully renovated museum such a remarkable attraction. Pienza's beauty was used as a backdrop to Franco Zeffirelli's masterpiece: "Romeo and Juliet."

listing.listing_address: San Casciano dei Bagni, Toscana, Italy

listing.listing_description:
The colorful elegance that is the essence of Barcelona is manifested in this chic downtown apartment. Luxury Palacete is the perfect urban retreat for an action-packed vacation to Spain’s culture capital. After a day eating paella on the beach, browsing in downtown Gracia and witnessing architecture that will leave you breathless, come back to this designer space to relax.

Crown mouldings, antique plush furniture and stunning chandeliers bring a palpable sense of glamour to the space. A fully equipped, modern and spacious kitchen is ideal for evenings you decide to eat in; just beside the kitchen is a large dining table for everyone to have a relaxed meal together. In the living room, soft white sofas are livened by crimson red and eggplant purple throws. A full library lines the wall for afternoon reading—and handmade curtains can be drawn to hide or reveal the vibrant city lights.

There are three bedrooms in total, comfortably sleeping up to six guests. The master has a king size bed, en suite bathroom and shower. It’s an ideal apartment a group of three couples, allowing ample privacy as well as comfortable and stylish communal spaces. Enjoy sleeping in, getting ready for the day and meeting your fellow travelers on the villa’s private terrace for morning coffee.

Whether you consider yourself a foodie, art lover or architecture addict, Barcelona will enchant you. A city where the clock is irrelevant and happiness is, you are guaranteed to leave with a greater appreciation for the finer things in life. Days on the beach will be complemented by evenings eating the best tapas and drinking premiere cava or specially distilled gins. The liveliness that is the city is matched by this beautifully unique space.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

Registration: HUTB-006757

listing.listing_description:
Located in the Val D'Orcia Region, Aiola is a strikingly beautiful, restored country house that is part of a 1700-acre estate. An intimate, luxurious haven, Aiola is ideal for private getaways and family reunions. Larger groups can also rent Villa Monticchia, which is part of the same estate.

This lovely villa is located in the Val d'Orcia region, south of Tuscany. This extraordinarily beautiful stretch of Italy sits between Rome and Florence with open, breathtaking views of Mount Amiata. Aiola is very close to San Casciano dei Bagni, a beautiful unspoiled medieval village that is one of the well-kept secrets of this special region.

The property's ground floor features a spacious living/game room with a billiard and gambling table. There is a lovely dining area with an open kitchen corner with direct access to the garden. Also on the ground floor are a queen bedroom and twin bedroom, each with its own private bathroom.

Aiola's first level provides special spaces for dining and relaxation. The reception/living hall with fireplace, living/television room and elegant dining room provide ideal gathering spaces for guests. The master suite has a queen-sized bedroom and a private bathroom with shower. Two twin bedrooms, one full bedroom and two additional bathrooms make this a wonderful place to share with friends and family.

Wander outside the villa and you can revel in the carefully tended gardens and extensive lawn, ideal for lounging. Take a walk in Aiola's private woods, or as an alternative, while away an afternoon dining al fresco in the private pergola, taking breaks for a refreshing dip in Aiola's impressive and beautiful swimming pool. The nearest village, San Casciano dei Bagni, is 15 minutes away by car.

Copyright © 2013 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: SPECIAL CHARACTERISTICS Aiola provides maximum comfort in a peaceful, refined and very private atmosphere. Guests can enjoy walks and bike rides through the property’s private paths, and visits to nearby Montepulciano, Montalcino, and Cetona - famous for their history, cuisine and wineries. Close by is San Casciano Dei Bagni - its old Roman Spa has recently been refurbished offering a natural hot water pool, beauty and health treatments. Among the magnificent qualities of Aiola is its cuisine, supervised by a Tuscan cook who has mastered the traditional culinary skills of the region.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Schiso is a stunning seaside villa near Taormina in northeast Sicily. Situated along a serene and secluded stretch of coast, a short walk from Giardini Naxos, the newly refurbished villa enjoys spectacular views of the Ionian Sea from its beautiful alfresco terraces and interior living areas. With six superb bedroom suites, as well as private spa and wellness amenities, this vacation rental is ideal for family reunions and unforgettable getaways with friends on one of Sicily's finest shores.

Enjoy your morning espresso and breakfast on the balcony as you gaze upon the dreamy horizon. Savor exquisite hours in the Mediterranean sun, floating in the lovely swimming pool, bathing in the hot tub, and sipping cool drinks on elegant loungers. At meal time, gather on the gorgeous patio for a sea-view feast, and linger outdoors in the evening, sipping delicious cocktails as the sunset transforms the Sicilian sky.

Arched French doors and windows invite the splendid views and air indoors. Open a bottle of fine Italian wine in the spacious living room, with its high ceilings, sweeping staircase, and sumptuous sofas, before gathering around the circular dining table for a delectable feast. The luminous, fully equipped kitchen includes a sea-view window, a lovely breakfast table, and doors to the alfresco dining patio. Downstairs, the villa includes an exercise room, massage table, and emotional shower. At extra cost, a variety of deluxe services are available to enhance your experience, including spa treatment, cooking classes, and gourmet tastings.

The villa's six bedrooms all feature cozy double beds as well as ensuite bathrooms. Several feature lovely arched windows with beautiful views, and the downstairs bedrooms enjoy their own living room. Simple yet elegant, the bedrooms are ideal for afternoon siestas and tranquil nights in tune with the rhythms of the sea.

Villa Schiso is wonderfully situated for exploring the natural and cultural splendor of northeast Sicily. Within walking distance of Giardini Naxos Beach, you're also minutes by car from the historical center of Taormina, and a short drive from Alcantra River Natural Park. At extra cost, your vacation rental may include adventurous excursions by helicopter, raft, bike, or foot across the island's stunning terrain.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Beautiful sights inside and out distinguish Villa Di Corsano. The 18th century villa is set on a secluded piece of land outside Siena and has stunning outdoor spaces and views of the countryside. Inside the three-story, ten-bedroom home, trompe l’oeil paintings give the impression of an indoor garden in spacious rooms large enough for the whole family.

During your stay, spend some time exploring the park in which the villa is set, making your way to the pool, the pool terrace with lounge chairs under a pergola and the outdoor barbecue. The villa’s sunny yellow walls conceal an internal courtyard, which has its own well and a covered loggia perfect for al fresco dining. Though it dates from the 1700s, the building now has Wi-Fi access.

Once you’ve finished seeing the grounds, continue exploring inside Villa Di Corsano. The spacious living room was originally the ballroom and still features fascinating paintings of exotic flora and fauna on its vaulted ceiling. The dining hall can seat twenty, and features original tiled floors, antique furniture, a 16th century marble sink and a huge sit in fireplace. The kitchen is also big enough to serve twenty, and features modern, professional equipment.

The villa has four bedrooms with double beds and en-suite bathrooms; one of them, the master suite, sets an elegant tone with a Murano chandelier and 17th century painting. There are two more bedrooms with double beds; one has a shared bathroom and the other has a double sofa bed and private bathroom. There are also two bedrooms with two twin beds each and en-suite bathrooms, one bedroom with three single beds and an en-suite bathroom, and one bedroom with two twin beds and a shared bathroom.

As its name implies, Villa Di Corsano is 1 km from the town of Di Corsano. Also nearby is the medieval city of Siena, which can be seen in the distance from several of the villa’s bedrooms and is about a 12 km drive away. Pack your suit for a visit to the beach in Follonica, 70 km away, or the shores of Castiglione della Pescaia, 80 km away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Engulfed by world-famous history, this regal, contemporary apartment is located on the second piano nobile of this Venice-based pallazzo. Take a short, scenic walk to the Rialto Bridge (the oldest bridge spanning the Grand Canal) and discover a new favourite gelato or espresso spot. 

Towering dove-grey ceilings are framed by bronze stucco moulding and elongated windows overlooking the floating city. Italian-inspired furniture, including plump couches and a contemporary glass dining table, detail the interior. A long threaded carpet leads the way to dusty pink and black flecked antique terrazzo flooring that flows throughout. Stainless steel, glass, and oxidised brass details are visually softened by traditional embroidery and a harmonious palette of hushed hues. Wake up to the sounds of the rippling canal and its many boats gliding through. 

The shared garden and alfresco kitchen area is a serene spot to sip a glass of wine. Admire works of art at Scuola Grande di San Rocco, or visit the iconic St Mark's Basilica on an afternoon of exploring the city. Northern Italy’s Lido di Venezia, an 11-kilometer sandbar where the Venice Film Festival takes place, is nearby. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This extraordinary one-bedroom villa is the dream setting for your honeymoon in Tuscany. Heralded as one of the world's finest villas for couples by the likes of Condé Nast Traveller, the recently restored masterpiece consists of an ancient stone watchtower with a modern, sumptuously appointed glass pavilion wrapped around its base, set within an enchanting country estate near Siena.

Savor the exquisite Tuscan light on the outdoor terrace, as you bathe in the marble hot tub and dip into the oxygenated infinite swimming pool. Cook a delicious lunch at the outdoor kitchen under the pergola, mixing refreshments at the wet bar and relishing your meal alfresco. In the afternoon, venture out on the villa's two hybrid bicycles for a beautiful ride through the country, and linger outdoors at sunset and into the starry night, sipping glasses of local wine.

The interior includes numerous cozy spaces for exquisite relaxation and delectable dining. Floor-to-ceiling glass walls invite aromatic breezes and sublime views into the interior pavilion. Enjoy afternoons cuddling on the daybed or bathing in the marble soaking tub overlooking the fishpond. Savor evening aperitivi in the sumptuous living lounge with panoramic views, before sitting down to a classic Italian feast. The fully equipped kitchen combines contemporary amenities, including an espresso and cappuccino maker, with exquisite antique vestiges such as a medieval baking oven. Gorgeous tile floors, walls of exposed stone and brick, and charming wood ceiling rafters evoke the consummate, rustic elegance of the Sienese regions.

The master suite occupies the two upper stories of the ancient tower. On the upper level, the sumptuous bedroom adjoins a bathroom with rain shower, while the lower level includes a living room with classic Tuscan fireplace. The library with day bed and ensuite bathroom can comfortably accommodate an additional guest.

The Casina provides you with a lovely location for exploring the infinite delights of Tuscany by foot, bicycle, or car. You're just a ten-minute walk from Cetinale Papal Villa and the horse stables at Ficareto, while the river swimming at Brenna is a ten-minute drive away. Travel fourteen kilometers to Siena for fine dining, the Palio horse race, and the Pinacoteca Nazionale. Florence, San Gimignano, and the wine capital of Montalcino are within easy reach. The Casina is the only home in Tuscany to be featured in Conde Nast’s 2019 Gold List Honeymoon Guide. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy access to one of the most exclusive amenities in London at One Jermyn Street. Not only is this luxury apartment beautifully furnished and centrally located in the St. James area, it opens to its own private outdoor spaces overlooking the city. Its two bedrooms make it a perfect choice for a family with children, two couples or a honeymoon-style break in a prime neighborhood.

After a day out shopping or sightseeing, pour a glass of wine and unwind on the terrace, then sit down to dinner at the al-fresco table. On cool or rainy evenings—this is London, after all—turn on the heat inside and settle down by the satellite TV or Wi-Fi. For your convenience, the villa also has an espresso machine and laundry facilities.

This spacious vacation rental is laid out around an open-concept living and dining room with an ornate fireplace, mid-century-inspired furnishings and chic metallic accents. The separate kitchen is bright, sleek and fully equipped.

One Jermyn Street has one master bedroom with a queen bed, en-suite bathroom and air conditioning. The second bedroom has a queen bed and shared access to a hall bathroom. For larger parties or those traveling with older children who want their own space, there is a double sofa bed in the living room.

Of course, you’ll want to spend your holiday seeing the city—and the apartment’s location makes it a snap. It’s a 4-minute walk from One Jermyn Street to Piccadilly Circus and less than a 10-minute drive to iconic sights such as Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace and Hyde Park. Listen to Big Ben chime the hours, let yourself be tempted by the displays at Harrods, take a ride on the London Eye or simply try out the restaurants and pubs in the neighborhood.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Chalet Mckinley conjures feelings of an alpine palace in the heart of Zermatt. Located within the 7 Heavens project—a new complex of seven outstanding chalets just steps from the Zermatt lift—this five-bedroom private residence features extraordinary living areas, an outstanding private spa, and top-shelf luxury services including a chalet manager, chef, and daily housekeeping. With five deluxe bedrooms accommodating ten, your chalet is ideal for large or multiple families seeking a supreme balance of convenience, comfort, and style in the Swiss Alps.

On the chalet's top floor, the open-plan Great Room with vaulted wood ceilings combines classic alpine structure with lovely elements of contemporary Swiss design. A double-sided, modernist, wood-burning fireplace warms the space, situated between the ample, sumptuous lounge area and the long, feast-ready dining table. Floor-to-ceiling windows gaze out on stunning views of Zermatt and the Matterhorn, and you can step onto the spacious balcony to savor the fresh mountain air. With a fully equipped kitchen featuring an island wet bar and excellent wine cooler, the Great Room is the perfect setting for festive and relaxing evenings together.

Between the first and second floor is the chalet's superb private spa. After spirited adventures on the slopes, relax in the exquisite Hammam, soothe your muscles in the sauna, and treat yourself to a massage. Bathe your body in the hot tub and immerse yourself in the delicious plunge pool. In the morning, work up a sweat in the fitness center before hitting the slopes anew.

The chalet features five exquisite bedrooms distributed over three floors. On the first floor are three guestrooms with double beds, while the second floor includes the master suite with king bed as well as the fourth double bedroom. All of the bedrooms feature ensuite bathrooms and private furnished balconies with mountain views. Wood ceilings and walls create a charmingly cozy ambiance. Additionally, there is a set of kid-friendly bunk beds adjacent to the playroom, with access to a separate shower room.

Chalet McKinley enjoys perhaps the finest location in Zermatt, literally steps from the central ski lift and Riderweg Slope, as well as the heart of downtown. Golfers will drive just a few minutes to the excellent Golf Club Matterhorn.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
In the 1700s, Count Cosimo Bernardini created a haven in the hills that surround the ancient walled city of Lucca. Originally constructed as a hunting lodge, this historical residence is today an exclusive Tuscan retreat immersed in a splendid parkland of ornamental ponds, antique fountains, time forgotten courtyards and lemon-scented Italian gardens. With original features and picturesque views over the hills and olive groves, Villa Borgo Bernardini is a home of rare beauty and sublime tranquility. Live it up!

The grounds at this spectacular vacation rental showcase a beautiful swimming pool surrounded by a large, lush and green lawn. You will find plenty of sun loungers, a barbeque and an impressive alfresco dining area with seating for twenty-four. The perks inside include an ice maker, espresso machine, satellite television, sound system and Wi-Fi. With a dedicated wine tasting room featuring a private collection of local wines, oenophiles will be in heaven. From a billiards room, to an exercise room and an office space, this villa has all of your holiday needs covered!

Additional spaces include a domed music room with log fireplace, a grand banquet room and several comfortable lounges. In keeping with the villa’s gentle and enchanting atmosphere, the unique interiors are elegantly furnished in true old world style. Antiques, chandeliers and statues recall the deep heritage of Italian culture. The gourmet Tuscan kitchen with its multiple gas burners and center island is perfect for a catered affair.

Twelve enchanting guestrooms with en-suite bathrooms accommodate up to twenty-four guests at this non-smoking villa. The individually-styled bedrooms are a reflection of gracious living discreetly blended with the typical Tuscan hamlet style of wood beamed ceilings, terracotta floors and warm, welcoming colors. We recommend this villa for a family holiday, a corporate retreat or a special celebration like a wedding.

During your stay at Villa Borgo Bernardini, you will be just a few minutes away from tennis courts and a golf course as well as the towns of Lucca and Pisa. Your reservation includes chef services, housekeeping and complimentary villa pre-stocking. As you will soon find out, Tuscan cuisine is itself quite simple, focusing on natural flavors – and perhaps therein lies some part of the secret to what Italians call la dolce vita, or living ‘the sweet life.’ Come experience the best of Tuscany with Luxury Retreats!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Host a special family event, a business retreat or even a romantic destination wedding in a dreamy 15th-century Catalan manor at Masia Victoria. This enchanting villa has gorgeous architectural detail and was recently renovated to add beautiful modern amenities. Two private patios, three large meeting rooms, a chapel and a location only 20 minutes from Barcelona’s El Prat airport make it easy to celebrate a birthday or anniversary, meet for a conference or hold an unforgettable ceremony.

This luxury vacation rental opens to two pretty courtyards with al-fresco sitting and dining areas both sunny and shaded, a long pool, plenty of lounge chairs and a barbecue. If you’ll be holding an event, choose from a spacious conference room, two meeting rooms and a chapel for the venue. For a quiet evening in after a day of sightseeing, there’s a cozy wood-burning fireplace, satellite television and Wi-Fi, so it’s easy to share your holiday photos.

Thoughtful renovations have preserved the original detail and character of this incredible estate. Arched doorways and thick wooden doors lead into an entryway lined with trompe l’oeil features and re-creations of iconic Renaissance paintings. The long living room is bright and airy, with natural-fiber area rugs anchoring several seating areas, and the formal dining room seats twenty under elegant chandeliers. There are several more intimate living and dining areas, and a fully equipped professional kitchen.

Masia Victoria has thirteen bedrooms and a honeymoon suite, all with en-suite bathrooms or private access to a hall bathroom. There are twelve bedrooms with king beds, several of which can be separated into two twin beds if desired, and one bedroom with a queen bed. The honeymoon suite has a king bed and its own en-suite bathroom.

The villa’s upper floors have a charming view of the Spanish countryside—think rolling hills and tranquil vineyards. But Masia Victoria is extremely convenient to the sights of Sitges, a resort town with a promenade along the Mediterranean lined with stately mansions, plenty of oceanfront restaurants, an old town full of winding streets just waiting to be explored and a beach. Active guests can drive to the nearby tennis club and golf course, while day-trippers will be keen to spend time in downtown Barcelona.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
